intro: Sarcomphalus taylorii, commonly known as Taylor's sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Sarcomphalus taylorii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun.
